Title: St. John, IN
Descriptive Text: Lake County, 31 miles S of the Loop. Early German settlers named St. Johns (the s disappeared in the early twentieth century) as a tribute to John Hack, one of its first settlers. German Catholics supported bilingual education and establishment of the first Roman Catholic church of Lake County in 1842. In the late twentieth century the town attracted Chicago commuters, with population growing from 1,757 in 1970 to 8,382 in 2000.
